gurmukhi: iblok moinsM juDM ccauD ckRqM BvM ] mmoh AwSRmM gqM ppwq BUqlM irsM ]461]
transliteration: Bilok Monisan Judhan Chachaudh Chakratan Bhavan|| Mamoh Aashramannd Gadan Paapat Bhootalan Risan||461||
translation: Seeing that war the whole world was dazzled and wonder-struck and moving towards that hermitage, it was falling down upon the earth under the impact of attachment.461.

gurmukhi: sBwr Bwr bsinnM jj`ip jwpxo irKM ] inhwir pwn pY prw ibcwr bwiesvO gurM ]
transliteration: Sobhaar Bhaar Basninan Jajapp(i) Jaapano Rikhan|| Nidaar(i) Paan Pai Paraa Bichaar Bade Savau Guran||
translation: That woman, carrying her utensils on her head, was moving remembering her husband like a sage and the sag seeing her and falling at her feet adopted her as the twenty-second Guru;

gurmukhi: ibAMq jogxo sDM AsMK pwpxo dlM ] Anyk cylkw ley irKyS AwsnM clM ]462]
transliteration: Beant Jagado Sadhan Asankh Paapano Dalan|| Anek Chelkaa Lae Rikhesh Aasanan Chalan||462||
translation: That great sage, who had performed innumerable Yogic practices and destroying many sins, moved towards his abode.462.

gurmukhi: ieiq hr bwhqw bweIsvo gurU iesqRI Bwq lY AweI smwpqM ]22]
transliteration: It(i) Har Baahtaa Baaeesavo Guroo Istribhaat Lai Aaisamaaptan||22||
translation: End of the description of the adoption of the Ploughman as the Twenty-second Guru, and his wife bringing the food.

gurmukhi: AQ qiRAw j`CxI qyeIsmo gurU kQnM ]
translation: Now begins the description of adopting a Yaksha woman as the twenty-third Guru

gurmukhi: AnUp nwd du`DrM auTMq inSnM surM ] BjMq Air idqM AGM iblok BwrgvM iBsM ]
transliteration: Bajant Naad Duddharan Outhant Nishanan Suran|| Bhajant Ar(i) Ditan Aghan Bilok Bhaargadan Bhisan||
translation: The trumpets sounded and there was thundering voice; seeing the ochre-coloured garb the sins were destroyed;

gurmukhi: iblok kMcnM igrMq q`j mwnuKI BuAM ] ssuhk qwpsI qnM Alok lokxo bpM ]463]
transliteration: Bilok Kanchanndng Girant Tajj Maanoukhi Bhuan|| Sasuhak Taapsitanan Alok Lakano Bapan||463||
translation: The gold was seen being showered on the earth inhabitated by human beings and the bodies of the ascetic were supernatural glory.463.

gurmukhi: Anyk j`C gMDRbM bsyK ibiD kw DrI ] inrkq nwgxI mhw bsyK bwsvI surI ]
transliteration: Anek Jachchh Gaddhraban Basekh Bidh(i) Kaa Ddaree|| Nirkat Naagadimahaa Basekh Baasavisuree||
translation: Many Yaksha, Gandharava, Naga and godâ€™s women were dancing;

gurmukhi: pivqR prm pwrbqI AnUp Awlkw pqI ] Askq AwipqM mhw ibsyK AwsurI surI ]464]
transliteration: Pavitra Param Paarbatianoop Aalkaa Patee|| Asakat Aapitan Mahaa Bisekh Aasurisuree||464||
translation: There was Parvati and the wife of the unique Kuber; there were seated the women off gods and demons.464.

gurmukhi: AnUp eyk j`CxI mmoh rwgxo mnM ] GumMq GUrxM iCqM lgMq swrMgo srM ]
transliteration: Anoop Ek Jachchhanimanoh Raagado Manan|| Ghoumant Ghooranan Chhitan Lagadt Saarano Saran||
translation: There was there a unique Yakssha woman, who was revolving in a circle as if she was struck by an arrow;

gurmukhi: ibswr nyh gyhxM snyh rwgxo mnM ] miRgI sjwxu GUmqM kiRqyx kiRs kiRqIsrM ]465]
transliteration: Bisaar Neh Gehanan Saneh Raagado Manan|| Mrigisajaan(u) Ghoomatan Kriten Kris Kriteesaran||465||
translation: Abandoning all kinds of desires, her mind was absorbed only in music; she was moving agitated like a deer.465.

gurmukhi: rJIJ rwgxo icqM bdMq rwg su pRBM ] bjMq ikMgurI krM mmoh AwSRmM gqM ]
transliteration: Rajheejh Raagado Chitan Badant Raag Su Prabhan|| Bajant Kinfurikaran Mamoh Aashrman Gadan||
translation: She was absorbed in singing in various male and female musical modes and playing on her fiddle, she went lovingly towards the hermitage;
